intro: Plectritis samolifolia var. involuta, commonly known as the curled plectritis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are finely divided and often curl inward, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in late spring to early summer.
